title: Ojima-ojo
author: Ojima-ojo
content: This topic is created with the intention to make it self-moderated,  but then I had a second thoughts about allowing everyone to contribute to the discussion since the aim of creating the topic is to explore ways to examine members progress and experience in  Bitcoin since the start of your Bitcoin accumulation and bitcointalk activities. The versatility of the topic and the relevance of individuals' contributions and experience contributed to my leaving the topic for general discussion instead of self-moderated. So the big question is,  how will you rate yourself since your involvement and interaction with Bitcoin and bitcoin talk as a community,  have you become more financially educated resulting in your consistency in building a financially free future by accumulating Bitcoin and spending less and investing more,  or have you become more Conservative in your approach taking Bitcoin as get a rich quick scheme that will always end you in frustration? What have become you financial life and status in the society and how have you managed your privacy using Bitcoin?                                                                                 My self-rating Bitcoin have become a life changing financial tool for me since my involvement with Bitcoin,  more also what have impacted my thought positively is my contact with this forum bitcointalk,  which gave me access to wealth of informations Ion Bitcoin and other financial topics that have helped shape my mindset and help me make better informed financial analysis and decisions. 90% of my thoughts originate from Bitcoin in terms of investment,  and the other 10% is on related topics that come up here in the forum,  being a Bitcoin maximalist my entire portfolio starts and ends with Bitcoin.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Didn't know crap about anything about investing and finance in general before Bitcoin — it pretty much became my first stepping stone. Now I pretty much trade stocks and crypto as my main source of income, and I'm pretty much the "finance" and "markets" guy in my local circle despite me not having a finance-related degree.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: I mean It has surely impacted a lot in terms of finance and my understanding of the market, what is demand/supply and why it even exists when we already have actual currency. So I surely think it increases your intellectual and financial skills If you invest time in understanding Bitcoin and the markets around it. For the privacy part, I haven't got the chance to use Bitcoin much and currently using it to HODL or like a piece of gold. I bought a domain with Crypto.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: First and foremost I would say thank you for signature campaign, maybe if I not joined a signature campaign, I will not have any Bitcoin until now. The reason is simple, when you want to try something new, you fear if you will do something wrong. However since I get paid in Bitcoin and just hold it, I feel the volatility of Bitcoin isn't a problem and I can deal with it. Accumulating Bitcoin and hold it to make big profit in the future will make you think you will become rich, yeah you're rich but financially free is when you can still earn money without need to work. If you not have at least 100 Bitcoins, I don't think someone is financially free.

comments.author: Agbamoni
comments.body: I became familiar with bitcoin at late September 2022 ever since then my knowledge increased, and I spread to know more about the blockchain and other altcoins. I am delighted I devoted my time and learnt everything i know now and i am willing to learn more as long as it has a good impact to me.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on July 25, 2023, 10:55:58 AMSo the big question is,  how will you rate yourself since your involvement and interaction with Bitcoin and bitcoin talk as a community,  have you become more financially educated resulting in your consistency in building a financially free future by accumulating Bitcoin and spending less and investing more,  or have you become more Conservative in your approach taking Bitcoin as get a rich quick scheme that will always end you in frustration? The forum has improved my approach to saving and spending. Financial terms like long-term investment, Dollar Cost Average (DCA), Hodl, FUD, and others have made more meaning to me. The forum has instilled the attitude of longtime investments and the need to be patient and wait for your investment to mature. DCA average has made investing quite easy for me and my investment don't have so much impact on my finance. I have also been exposed to the concept of Fear, Uncertainty, and Doubt and how institutions and influential individuals use it to manipulate the market, so I have learned bravery and focus. My taste or desire to invest in money-doubling schemes has been quenched by this forum.QuoteWhat have become you financial life and status in the society and how have you managed your privacy using Bitcoin?      Financially the forum has been good to me. My engagement in this forum has been fruitful financially. Regarding the change of social status, I am still that young man working quietly in the street of a developing nation. I have always kept the financial part of my life secret hence my social status is still the same. I have learned so much about privacy and security so I don't want to attract criminals to myself by telling people about my relationship with bitcoin and the forum. My phones and laptops have better security and I am more conscious about not using my phone in public spaces. I am also conscious now about clicking on links to avoid hacks and privacy invasion strategies.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: First of all I want to say that this forum is very useful for all of us, because here we can learn a lot about bitcoin and other crypto and educate us to be more mature in doing or planning good things regarding all discussions or knowledge about this industry in this forum. And we would never get this forum before even in the real world, so this forum is a very valuable teacher.and anyone who engages with bitcoin with this forum is sure to get a decent profit, thanks to the knowledge and good advice one gets on this forum.and financially bitcoin is very helpful and can also change someone's life for the better than before. And the financial freedom that we get from bitcoin doesn't mean we have to use it often because in the future bitcoin is much more profitable and we have to be more efficient and also keep buying to cover what we used before so that in the future we still have lots of bitcoin.

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: Before Bitcoin I was a humble middle class employees in India. I followed what everyone in my country did and was proud about it. Untill I found that everything the government said was a myth and everything to date is to make rich more rich and the poor to remain a poor. The recent tax on our earning is the best example. Without any regulations the government went ahead and placed a tax on our earnings.These tax rules are not clear and are harsh. As the government is governed by burecrats these ministers are now being questioned. We will never achieve our full potential as the government has been only promoting.those who are in to software. They never thought about trading, social media promotion & etc. They are still in the old age and they will still be the same. Unless the government rethink.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on July 25, 2023, 10:55:58 AMSo the big question is,  how will you rate yourself since your involvement and interaction with Bitcoin and bitcoin talk as a community,  have you become more financially educated resulting in your consistency in building a financially free future by accumulating Bitcoin and spending less and investing more,  or have you become more Conservative in your approach taking Bitcoin as get a rich quick scheme that will always end you in frustration?Definitely not the latter.Financially speaking, I have become more educated. I don't hold any other asset, though. So, my portfolio's worth varies from time to time, according to the price of bitcoin. I wouldn't say bitcoin has taught me to be financially dependent; I think that's rather difficult, and can't come to you without lots of action. No, bitcoin holders from the early days aren't counted. What I do acknowledge, though, is that bitcoin has given me the interest to study money. As a politically neutral currency, it raises you concerns of whether the financial system is working as envisioned, and pinpoints its flaws.

comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on July 25, 2023, 10:55:58 AMThe versatility of the topic and the relevance of individuals' contributions and experience contributed to my leaving the topic for general discussion instead of self-moderated.Self moderated topics simply means that the op acts as the moderator in the thread to delete spam, so creating a self moderated thread doesn't stop the thread from being open for discussion to everybody, except you create your own local rule that stops certain members from replying in your topic.Quote from: Ojima-ojo on July 25, 2023, 10:55:58 AMWhat have become you financial life and status in the society and how have you managed your privacy using Bitcoin? My status hasn't changed at all, there's no way it was ever going to change because of BTC anyway, i am not an early adopter, neither do i have too much money to buy as much BTC's as i desire. BTC and the forum has helped me a lot in terms of privacy and security, i now value the fact that i can use a currency that is resistant to censorship and also permissionless, before BTC i never cared about where i gave out my data, but now i know the importance of keeping a private financial life and also staying private.
